com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core

Interface IFactorTableIterator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<FactorTableEntry>

    @NotThreadSafe
public interface IFactorTableIterator
extends java.util.Iterator<FactorTableEntry>
    Iterator over entries in a IFactorTable.

    Supports several styles of iteration. The first uses the traditional Iterator approach: 

         while (iter.hasNext())
     {
        FactorTableEntry entry = iter.next();
        ... entry.weight() ...
     }
    You can also iterate simply by calling next() and testing for null: 
         for (FactorTableEntry entry; (entry = iter.next()) != null;)
     {
        ... entry.weight() ...
     }
    If you want to avoid allocating a new entry object for each iteration, you can instead use advance() and get the current attributes directly from the iterator: 
         while (iter.advance())
     {
        ... iter.weight() ...
     }
    Iterators can be obtained from IFactorTableBase.iterator() and IFactorTableBase.fullIterator().
    Since:
    0.05

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean advance()
      Advance to the next entry.
      JointDomainIndexer domains()
      Domains of underlying factor table.
      double energy()
      Returns the energy for the entry at the current iteration.
      FactorTableEntry getEntry()
      Returns current entry or null either if end of iteration has been reached or neither advance() nor next() has been called at least once.
      int[] indices()
      Returns domain indices corresponding to the table entry at the current iteration in newly allocated array.
      int[] indices(int[] array)
      Returns domain indices corresponding to the table entry at the current iteration using provided indices array if it is non-null and of the correct length.
      int[] indicesUnsafe()
      Returns domain indices corresponding to the table entry at the current iteration in read-only array.
      int jointIndex()
      Returns the joint index for the entry at the current iteration or -1 if joint indices are not supported for this iterator.
      FactorTableEntry next()
      Returns the next entry in the iteration or else null.
      void remove()
      Method not supported.
      boolean skipsZeroWeights()
      Indicates whether the iterator will skip over table entries that have a zero weight (or infinite energy).
      int sparseIndex()
      Returns the sparse index for the entry at the current iteration.
      double weight()
      Returns the weight for the entry at the current iteration.

        hasNext

      • next

        @Nullable
FactorTableEntry next()
        Returns the next entry in the iteration or else null. It is not necessary to invoke Iterator.hasNext() before this method.

      • indicesUnsafe

        int[] indicesUnsafe()
        Returns domain indices corresponding to the table entry at the current iteration in read-only array.

        The returned array may return an internal representation and must not be modified!

        See Also:
        indices(), indices(int[])

      • jointIndex

        int jointIndex()
        Returns the joint index for the entry at the current iteration or -1 if joint indices are not supported for this iterator.

      • skipsZeroWeights

        boolean skipsZeroWeights()
        Indicates whether the iterator will skip over table entries that have a zero weight (or infinite energy).
